newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan VP says stocks healthy, but shallow.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan VP says stocks healthy, but shallow.

text.p: Taiwan's Vice President Lien Chan said the stock market's bull run reflected nothing but the island's strong economy, local newspapers reported on Saturday.

"Speaking overall, the economic development and its solid growth have been fully reflected in the (stock) market, which is why I say the stock market is healthy," Lien told the Economic Daily News in an interview.

But Lien, who doubles as premier, said he was concerned about what he described as a "shallow-dish" stock market largely dominated by individual investors instead of institutional investors, and thus more volatile.
